old_printPage: You can print out this page if you’d like to use it as a checklist.
old_checklist1-item1: the original will – you must sign the first page in the top right corner, but not make any other changes to the will
old_checklist1-item2: any updates (‘codicils’) – you must sign the front of each codicil in the top right corner, but not make any other changes to the codicils
old_checklist2Header: 2. What the other applying executors need to sign
old_checklist2-item1: a photocopy of the will – they must all sign the same photocopy on the first page in the top right corner
old_checklist2-item2: photocopies of any updates (‘codicils’) – they must all sign the first page of each photocopy in the top right corner
old_checklist3-item1: 2 photocopies of the will that you’ve signed – these photocopies must be on plain A4 paper
old_checklist3-item1-codicils: 2 photocopies of the will and any updates (‘codicils’) that you’ve signed – these photocopies must be on plain A4 paper
old_checklist3-item2: the death certificate – this will be returned to you
old_checklist3-item3: a renunciation form filled in by any executors who are permanently giving up their right to make this application for probate
old_checklist3-item4-Form205: the completed inheritance tax form IHT 205
old_checklist3-item5-deedPoll: copy of the deed poll document for {executorCurrentName}
old_coverLetter: You’ll also need to include a cover letter if the will has been changed in any way since you got given it. This includes it being damaged or separated for photocopying. The letter should explain what’s been changed and why.
old_coverLetter-codicils: You’ll also need to include a cover letter if the will or any updates (‘codicils’) have been changed in any way since you got given them. This includes them being damaged or separated for photocopying. The letter should explain what’s been changed and why.
old_warning: The grant of probate won’t be issued if you don’t have all the necessary documents and signatures.
old_heading3: Send your documents to the probate registry
old_sendDocuments: You should send your documents using a signed-for postal service to:
old_sendDocumentsAddress:
Digital Application
Oxford District Probate Registry
Combined Court Building
St Aldates
Oxford
OX1 1LY
title: Send your documents
heading2: 2. Send your documents to the probate registry
text1: If you don’t have a printer, write your reference number {ccdReferenceNumber} on a sheet of paper and include it with your application.
text2: You need to send the probate registry:
text3: You’ll need to include a cover letter if the will or codicils have changed in any way since you’ve had them.
text4: The letter should explain whats been changed and why.
text5: You should send your documents using a signed-for postal service to:
warning: The grant of probate won’t be issued if you don’t have all the necessary documents.
address:
Digital Application
Oxford District Probate Registry
Combined Court Building
St Aldates
Oxford
OX1 1LY
checklist1-item1-no-codicils: the original will (this won’t be returned to you)
checklist1-item1-codicils: the original will and any updates (codicils) (these won’t be returned to you)
checklist2-item3-will-uploaded: the original death certificate (this will be returned to you)
checklist2-item4-iht205: the completed inheritance tax form IHT 205
checklist2-item5-renunciated: a renunciation form filled in by any executors who are permanently giving up their right to make this application for probate
checklist2-item6-deed-poll: copy of the deed poll document for {executorCurrentName}
checkboxLabel: I understand that I need to sign the will before sending my documents
checkboxLabel-codicils: I understand that I need to sign the will and any ‘codicils’ before sending my documents

required.summary: You haven’t agreed to the signing of the will (and any codicils)
required.message: Please tick the check box to agree to the signing of the will (and any codicils)
